intro: Scrophularia scorodonia var. multiflora, commonly known as the common mullein, is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems covered in soft, velvety gray-green leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a fuzzy texture. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish-yellow flowers in the summer, which are typically tubular and arranged in spikes. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Scrophularia scorodonia var. multiflora is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
